topics.body:
So I've decided to pick up a book and read some mythology and history books again after taking a break for a while and I've forgotten how fucked up a lot of things are:
99% of history and mythology summarized in one image and quote:
"'*HOLY FUCK IS THIS WRONG!'-Gilbert Gottfried
!http://media.apunkachoice.com/image/Upload-Image/Image/image-7-gilbert_gottfried2.jpg!":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qYId1a0--JU
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.author: 5154c5237f123bcd580002fc

topics.body:
"@twistedmetalero":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53e5588363687232a4460000#post_53e5588363687232a4460000
I know; could you imagine if we still operated on the belief murdering children or such was still moral?  Oh wait; there are still places like this in the world.  Could you imagine if we still killed people even after they surrendered and put up no resistanc- Oh wait; there are still places like this in the world.  Could you imagine if we still went around killing innocent people just to prove a point- Oh wait; there are still places like this in the world.  Could you imagine if we still went around killing children just cause they were the offspring of a opposing group's member- Oh wait; there are still places like this in the world.  Could you imagine if we still went around killing people and trying to exterminate them on the basis of what they look lik- Oh wait; there are still places like this in the world.

My point is honestly why do so many people believe that stories about murdering children is the epitome of morality?

Before you ask no it's not about Christianity, but in general a lot of cultures base their morality off history and mythology about genocide and then place the genocides as morally just.  You constantly hear about how "society's going downhill" or people are "losing their morals", but considering that shit like rape was considered a perfectly acceptable war tactic or tossing hundreds of people onto spikes while still alive was considered acceptable I'd have to massively disagree with that in that most countries have much higher standards of morality than back in the day.

Up until 2007 slavery was still legal in Mauritania and slavery was made illegal in 2003 in Niger.  If "losing their morals" then chances are shit like slavery would still be legal in a ton of countries.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:

It's like people who complain about Claud Frollo being a villain in Hunchback.

When you ADAPT something you're shouldn't just make it 100% the same. If a movie is exactly like a book then why would I watch the movie?
